pageContext.claim: “Really, [Greece had] one of the -- percentage-wise, one of the biggest increases in [GDP in] the world. And that's a big statement. And that's a tremendous comeback.”
pageContext.analysis: This is wrong. Greece's economy had negative growth in the first three months of 2019, and then grew by 0.6 percent on quarter in the three months of September 2019, easing from an upwardly revised 1.3 percent expansion in the previous period.
